Too little light. Glare. These are factors that contribute to eyestrain. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Poor lighting can also contribute to muscle soreness and fatigue. In poor light, you adopt awkward postures to see your screen or documents. For example, you might lean forward in low light to see your screen better, or lean sideways to avoid glare from a bright light overhead. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Glare shines directly into your eyes or is reflected from other surfaces (such as your screen, desk top, or walls) into your eyes. Sunlight is often a source of glare from the outside. Overhead lighting and desk lamps are often sources of glare from inside the workplace. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"You can perform a quick test with a mirror to help identify possible sources of glare. Sitting in your normal position, place a mirror — with the reflective side facing you — against your screen, then document holder, and then on your work surface. You will be able to see the objects in the mirror, such as overhead and task lights, that are possible sources of glare at your workstation. For example, if you look up, you can probably see several fluorescent light fixtures in the area of your workstation. When you look in the mirror, you will only be able to see reflections of those fixtures that could be sources of glare. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Glare control \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Ways of controlling glare are described in this section and are shown below. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Workstation position \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"To avoid glare from windows, position your computer workstation so that when you face the monitor, you are sitting beside or parallel to the window. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If you face the window, light from the outside shines directly into your eyes and makes it difficult for you to focus on the screen. If you sit with your back to a window, you may have problems with reflections, or high light levels. In either situation, adjust the blinds to reduce the amount of light on your screen. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Overhead lights can shine directly in your eyes or reflect images onto your computer screen, making it difficult to view your screen. To avoid either of these, locate computer workstations between rows of lights. If this isn’t possible, adjust the angle of your screen so that it’s at right angles to the work surface. If your screen is tilted toward the ceiling, you could have a glare problem. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"size\":51623,\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/16c0f73a-71e8-4257-9aac-39d26344961c/Hazard14.JPG?preview=true\",\"path\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/16c0f73a-71e8-4257-9aac-39d26344961c/Hazard14.JPG?preview=true\",\"fileName\":\"Hazard14.JPG\",\"name\":\"Hazard14.JPG\",\"mimeType\":{\"type\":\"image\",\"subtype\":\"jpeg\",\"parameters\":{},\"qualityValue\":1,\"wildcardType\":false,\"wildcardSubtype\":false,\"concrete\":true,\"charset\":null},\"type\":\"image\",\"id\":\"16c0f73a-71e8-4257-9aac-39d26344961c\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":489,\"height\":532},\"extension\":\"JPG\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Overhead lighting \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If you still have a problem with glare after making adjustments to your workstation, ask your supervisor if the amount of overhead lighting can be reduced. Light levels can be lowered and glare prevented by installing a dimmer switch or diffusers. Diffusers are a series of square cells in a grid that fits over a fluorescent fixture. They direct light vertically, reducing the angled light rays. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Task lighting \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"When light levels are low, illuminate the hard copy you are working from at the computer if you are having difficulty reading it. Use a desk lamp to provide additional light. To illuminate your writing surface, place your lamp to your left if you are right-handed so that the light shines in front of you from left to right. This stops the lamp from casting shadows of your hand and pen on the paper. If you are left-handed, place the lamp to your right. Avoid placing task lighting directly in front of you as this creates reflected glare from the desk or documents. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Oversized monitors \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Oversized monitors may increase your likelihood of experiencing problems with reflected glare because of their large surface area. Take care in placing these monitors in your work area. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Monitor controls \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Become familiar with the brightness and contrast controls on your computer monitor. Adjusting these controls can improve your viewing comfort. If you don’t know how to use these controls, ask your supervisor. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Colour monitors \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"On a colour monitor, a light background (for example, light grey) with darker lettering helps to minimize the effects of reflected glare on the monitor. To make the best use of your colour monitor avoid: \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Using several colours at one time — too many colours can be confusing\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Extreme colour contrasts such as red and blue — your eyes won’t tire as on yellow — it’s hard to read because there’s little contrast \",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Yellow on green — it creates a vibrating effect \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Opposite colours such as red and green, or yellow and blue, are good combinations.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Anti-glare screens \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"You can also install an anti-glare screen on your computer monitor if you can’t remove the source of glare. Glass anti-glare screens or filters are preferred to nylon mesh screens, which can reduce the clarity of the letters on the screen, making reading difficult. Glass screens maintain the clarity of the characters on your screen and enhance the colours. If you install an anti-glare screen, clean it regularly. This prevents dust build-up, which makes reading more difficult. Nylon mesh screens are particularly prone to dust build-up. Most newer monitors have tinted screens to control the glare. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Walls and finishes \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Matte (dull) finishes should be used on walls, floors, and furniture. A light- coloured, shiny finish on the work surface or behind the monitor, or white paper scattered on top of the work surface, can contribute to glare. Overhead lighting and desk lamps reflect off these surfaces into your eyes. \",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
